content.description: On the left side of the 8th wonder boulder, the second tier in terms of the ground. Start on the big jug low down and move straight up more or less on tiny crimps and a great left hand side pull up higher.
content.location: Start on obvious big low jug right of the flakes/crack

content.description: Find the obvious jugs, flakes and crack. Climb up them to the top. Could also be used as a down climb from 8th wonder if you don't want to walk around.
content.location: Left most problem. Find obvious cracks/flakes.

content.description:
Start with a left hand undercling and right hand side pull. Move up to a good jug and out right to follow big pockets and crimps to the sloping top out.

A sit start could be added that would give you an additional 2-3 moves.
content.location: Left hand undercling right hand side pull. Start below a big obvious jug.

content.description:
Near 8th wonder is a big bulge lurking in the trees. Find on the bulge where there are two good starting crimps above your head, move up and right onto the deep pockets and flat edges surmount the sloping top out.

*Advice: Clean the top out before you try to climb this as dirt will most likely cover the small edges you will want. You can do this by going around to the right side of the bulge and gaining a way up to the ledge.
content.location: Far left from 8th wonder. a big bulge at the bottom of a 50 foot slab tucked in the trees.
